medical_history.chief_complaint: Disabling depression in the context of presumptive Alzheimer's disease.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ms. A experienced progressive memory deficits for the past 4 years, with her depression developing over the course of the last year. She reported dysphoric feelings, loss of interest in daily activities, persistent lethargy, decreased appetite, and a weight loss of about 10 lbs over the past 2 months. Mr. B had a 1-year history of worsening memory, increased withdrawal, loss of interest in hobbies, weight loss of 14 lbs, and feelings of hopelessness and depression. Both patients did not respond to standard antidepressants initially.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ms. A has a history of cognitive decline consistent with Alzheimer's disease. Mr. B also has a history of cognitive decline consistent with mild Alzheimer's disease.
medical_history.family_history: Ms. A's father suffered numerous depressive episodes. Mr. B's mother had received ECT for severe depression and his older brother had chronic depression with at least one episode of psychotic depression requiring hospitalization.
medical_history.social_history: Ms. A's social history includes loss of interest in work, hobbies, and social activities. Mr. B's social history indicates he became increasingly withdrawn and stopped driving, displaying a notable decline in social engagement.
